solution_line_template: She bought {num_pies} pies that had {slices_per_pie} slices each for a total of {num_pies}*{slices_per_pie} = <<{num_pies}*{slices_per_pie}={total_initial_slices}>>{total_initial_slices} slices

Rebecca ate {rebecca_initial_slices_eaten} of the {total_initial_slices} slices leaving {total_initial_slices}-{rebecca_initial_slices_eaten} =<<{total_initial_slices}-{rebecca_initial_slices_eaten}={slices_after_rebecca_initial}>>{slices_after_rebecca_initial} slices

Her family and friends at {family_friends_percent_eaten_num}% of the pie so they ate {slices_after_rebecca_initial}*{family_friends_percent_eaten_decimal} = <<{slices_after_rebecca_initial}*{family_friends_percent_eaten_decimal}={family_friends_slices_eaten}>>{family_friends_slices_eaten} slices

There were {slices_after_rebecca_initial} slices and her family and friends ate {family_friends_slices_eaten} slices so that leaves {slices_after_rebecca_initial}-{family_friends_slices_eaten} = <<{slices_after_rebecca_initial}-{family_friends_slices_eaten}={slices_after_family_friends}>>{slices_after_family_friends} slices

Sunday night Rebecca and her husband each had a slice from the remaining slices so that leaves {slices_after_family_friends}-{rebecca_husband_slices_eaten} = <<{slices_after_family_friends}-{rebecca_husband_slices_eaten}={remaining_slices}>>{remaining_slices} slices
